title: Sales Representative Job at Agurate Online Limited
content:
Agu.ng is a nationally recognized fashion retailer owned and managed by Agurate Online Limited. Agurate Online Limited was incorporated under the Nigerian laws by the Corporate affairs commission in August 2015. We’re passionate about Fashion retail both online and offline – and it goes way beyond fashion.
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



At Agu.ng, fashion is a way of life. We provide the best fashion materials and accesories. We are located in Onitsha Mall, Enugu mall, Novare mall lekki, Novare Gateway Mall Abuja and Circle mall Osapa. As we strive to bring your lovely fashion to your neighborhood, you can always shop on our website.
We differentiate ourselves through a combination of unique designs and styles merged with unequaled standards of quality and authenticity. Our founders Agurate Online limited is a company built on hardwork, fairness and customer satisfaction.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Sales Representative 

Job Location: Circle Mall, Jakande, Lekki - Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	We are looking for a young and experienced Sales Associate who will engage and assist walk-in customers with product knowledge to optimize sales opportunities as well as managing financial transactions. (Females Only For Gender Balance)


Duties


	Welcome and guide walk-in customers.
	Provide accurate information (e.g., product features and pricing).
	Answer customers’ questions about specific products/services.
	Cross-sell products.
	Ensure racks are fully stocked.
	Inform customers about discounts and special offers.
	Provide customer feedback to the Store Supervisor.
	Stay up to date with new products/services.


Requirements


	Must have at least 2 years of sales experience
	Proximity to Circle Mall is very important
	Must stay around Lekki - Ajah axis


Salary
N120,000 / month.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: careers@agu.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

title: Warehouse Officer Job at Food Concepts Plc
content:
Food Concepts commenced operations in 2001. From inception, our aim has been clear-cut and focused: to revolutionize the food sector in West Africa and to deliver extraordinary satisfaction to our stakeholders.

Since launching in 2004, Chicken Republic (Subsidiary of Food concepts) has already opened 55 stores in Nigeria and Ghana. On this basis, we are proud of the brand’s hard-earned reputation as the fastest growing chicken QSR in West Africa and the number 1 chicken QSR in Nigeria (both in revenues and number of outlets). In addition, Chicken Republic was ranked as one of Nigeria’s top 20 brands across all categories (Financial Standards Awards 2009).

We are recruiting to fill the position below:
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Position: Warehouse Officer

Requisition ID: 1917
Job Location: Oregun, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Department:: Supply Chain Department
Reports to (Title): Warehouse/Logistics Manager

Job Purpose


	To operationalize the company’s warehouse and delivery process and ensure the deliverables and output are in line desired goals and objectives.


Core Responsibilities and Key Result Areas


	Inventory/Logistics Monitoring
	Ensure accuracy of stock picked for shipment
	Ensure zero stock losses both in Warehouse and in-transit to production units, regional warehouse hubs and stores
	Ensure full monitor adherence to health, safety and environmental guidelines
	Ensuring receipt of goods in line with specifications on purchase orders or as instructed by Supply Chain Division
	Apply appropriate asset management procedures in order to achieve maximum return on assets
	Perform continuous evaluation of warehouse security and implementation of necessary measures to maintain safety of stock.
	Develop preventative maintenance systems and contingency plans.
	Support in the offloading and loading of stocks in the warehouse
	Escort stocks to defined destination and ensure issuance is according to the waybill and invoice.
	Participate in cycle counting and monthly stock count activities
	Maintain high standard of housekeeping and hygiene in work area assigned
	Provide regular update on stock position as may be required
	Generate picklist based on requisition from the various units
	Update bin cards based on shipments of stock items to different Business units
	Update bin cards based on items received into the warehouse.


Key Performance Indicators


	Quality of stock delivered
	Savings on goods/services
	Level of target achieved
	Delivery turnaround time


Job Specifications


	A minimum of a Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration is required
	Minimum of 2 years of experience in similar role.
	Possession of any relevant certification is essential


Knowledge Requirements:


	Knowledge of warehouse management procedures and best practices
	Knowledge of warehouse management software and database
	Knowledge of warehousing, distribution and maintenance operations
	Knowledge of QSR/Food Industry trends/ practices.

title: Business Development Adviser Job at Society for Family Health
content:
Society for Family Health (SFH) is one of the leading non-governmental public health organisations in Nigeria, implementing programmes in Reproductive Health/Family Planning, HIV & AIDS prevention and treatment, malaria prevention and treatment, primary health care system strengthening and maternal, newborn and child health care. We work in partnership with the Federal and State Governments of Nigeria, the Global Fund, United States Agency for International Development (USAID), Department for International Development (DFID), Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation, MSD for Mothers and Children Investment Fund Foundation among other international donors.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Business Development Adviser
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Location: Lagos, Nigeria
Job type: Full time

Responsibilities
The successful candidate will be required to perform the following functions:


	Facilitate training of PPMVs on business development and entrepreneurship to utilize micro-credit to improve their delivery of products and services.
	Facilitate PPMV aggregation in the form of cooperatives to ensure easy access to low interest loans.
	Facilitate efforts to improve PPMV access to quality health commodity by facilitating engagement of PPMV networks with interested, reputable manufacturers and drug suppliers.
	Plan and conduct training programs to build capacity of PPMVs to manage commodity inventories better.
	Work with IntegratE team to ensure PPMVs are trained on LARC methods at the Schools of Health Technology in line with the approved guidelines for the three-Tiered Accreditation System.


Requirements
The successful candidate will be required to possess the following qualification:


	S/he must possess a Degree / equivalent in any of the management, social and biological sciences.
	A postgraduate Degree in Public Health or social works will be an advantage
	Candidates must have a minimum of 7 years post qualification experience in program management, training and business development and integration, especially among the private health sector / provider.


Technical Requirement:


	Business and entrepreneurship
	Development skills
	Good Negotiation
	Communication and presentation skills
	Ability to discover, create, and communicate the value of interventions.
	Must be proficient in the use of Microsoft word, power point and excel packages.
	Use factual data to produce and deliver credible and understandable reports.

title: Quantity Surveyor / Quality Control Officer Job at De Talents
content:
De Talents is currently recruiting suitably qualified candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Quantity Surveyor / Quality Control Officer

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Preparation of consolidated BOQs and Budgets for Internal and Client projects.
	Evaluation of tender submissions, ensuring quantities and specifications are in line with tender and projects specifications.
	Assist with preparation and Compilation of Tender documentations
	Assist in preparing cost estimate for different phases of the project, advice the project management on possible cost over runs and, on the action, necessary to remain within the approved project budget.
	Work very close with the project team to ensure that measurements, variations and contractual matters are properly recorded and notified.
	Evaluation of Value of work done (VOWD) by Contractors in preparation for payment certificates
	Work very close with the project team to ensure that measurements, variations and contractual matters are properly recorded and notified.
	Verify labour, plant & equipment (resources) strengths on projects
	Verify material deliveries i.e. quantities, quality for compliance with Specifications required purchase order.
	Monitor contractors and evaluate work progress on site.
	Prepare progress reports and flag any discrepancies immediately on the same day for all the above items
	Perform and implement all post contract duties including but not limited to measurements, preparation of variations orders, analysis of site design changes, interim valuation certificates, final accounts and evaluation reports.
	Maintain proper records of agreed measurement-oriented/Item rate variation with the client’s authorized representative and ensure compliance with such rates.
	Assist in collaboration with the Project Accountant in collecting the data to prepare financial reports and cash flow forecasts and financial and contractual matters related to work on site.
	Monitoring and Inspection of supplied Goods, Materials and Services ordered from Vendors and Suppliers to ensure that products and services meet established quality standards and specifications.
	Maintaining detailed records of inspections, identifying defects or deviations from quality standard or required specifications.
	Monitoring the effectiveness of existing processes and making recommendations for improvements to enhance overall purchase standards.


Requirements
Education and Qualifications:


	Qualifications from either a recognized institute or training Organization
	Relevance experience in job related field.


Experience:


	Minimum 5 years of relevant experience in related role.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their detailed CV to: hrdetalents@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note


	Your work experience should reflect start and end months and year (Example: July 2013 – May 2018).
	Only selected candidates will be contacted.
